title: Mr. Peters :
author: Stephens, Riccardo.
snippet: He had spent another hour at the Waverley Market, and he was satisfied that four or five hours more would make him able to ride and to teach.

title: Around the clock in Europe :
author: Howell, Charles Fish
snippet: Certainly there never was such pathos and unction devoted to just such a subject. And the music, too! How it compels you with its appealing monotones and rebukes you with the brave huckster cries on high F! So when you are passing near Waverley Market and encounter one of the picturesque Scandinavian fishwives, who has trudged in with her "woven willow " from her little stone house at Newhaven with the patched roof and quaint sore- stairs, unless you are willing to buy a herring then and there and carry it around in your pocket, run for your life before she starts singing: — .

title: Rambles in America, past and present.
author: Pairpoint, Alfred J.
snippet: orator, in the large, covered building called " Waverley Market," holding some twent}' thousand people. The impress of that marvellous voice, as we listened on the edge of that great crowd of upturned faces, was truly interesting.

title: Here and there in the Home Land. England, Scotland and Ireland as seen by a Canadian. ... Profusely illustrated
author: Haight, Canniff.
snippet: Came back to the city and bad dinner, after which I went out for a walk. Took my way7 along Princess Street, through the Waverley Gardens, past Scott's Monument, and over the top of Waverley Market. This has been con- verted into a roof garden, anel is a very pretty and attractive place.

title: Mr. Peters :
author: Stephens, Riccardo.
snippet: The morning after his chat with Melia he made his way, soon after breakfast, to the Waverley Market, and, going to the gallery there, looked down upon the picture of strug gling humanity that presented itself. Here were learners in all stages of desperation and despair, and Mr. Peters watched them with grave interest.

title: Rambles in America, past and present.
author: Pairpoint, Alfred J.
snippet: The weaving was most interesting ; the working of the shuttle and threads of the looms seemed to be executed with close precision. In the mattress room our attention was directed to the fine but sightless face of a middle-aged man, who grew quite animated and eloquent in his conversation with us, respecting the large concourse of people who would probably be at the monster meeting, to be held that evening in the Waverley Market building, to listen to Mr. Gladstone, in his great address on the franchise bill to the electors of AJ id-Lothian.

title: Mr. Peters :
author: Stephens, Riccardo.
snippet: It was to the Waverley Market they went that night for their crowd and found it.
